name: The National Association for the Blind
briefDescription: NAB , India one of the largest voluntary organizations established in 1952 has over 6 decades pioneered  childhood to old age services for the visually impaired. Our services includes screening of eyes, provision of spectacles , integrated education  of blind and multi disabled children along with sighted, welfare activities  of the visually challenged women including augmentation of income  through making of gift products , vocational training , helping visually challenged women in household matters and support for meeting medical expenses. Materials for education are provided through  Braille Press and Talking Book Centre.

address: Mulla House, 3rd Floor, 51 M G Road,
